doc:
Claire Luce https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Claire_Luce 0 Claire Luce (October 15, 1903 – August 31, 1989) was an American stage and screen actress, dancer and singer. Among her few films were Up the River (1930), directed by John Ford and starring Spencer Tracy and Humphrey Bogart in their feature film debuts (Luce played Bogart's love interest), and Under Secret Orders, the English-language version of G. W. Pabst's French-language feature, Mademoiselle Docteur (1937). Claire_Luce ( October_15_,_1903 – August_31_,_1989 ) was an_American_stage_and_screen_actress , dancer_and_singer . Among her_few_films were Up the_River_(_1930_) , directed by John_Ford and starring Spencer_Tracy and Humphrey_Bogart in their_feature_film debuts (_Luce played Bogart 's_love_interest_) , and Under Secret_Orders , the_English-language_version of G._W._Pabst 's_French-language_feature , Mademoiselle_Docteur_(_1937_) .
